CARDINAL . The applicant was arrested and remanded in custody on DATE . He lodged an appeal against the decision of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE ORG PERSON GPE ) allowed the applicant 's appeal and quashed the decision of DATE , but did not lift the applicant 's detention .

The relevant part of the reasoning reads :
“ The appeal is well - founded .

The defendant 's allegations that the impugned decision was adopted in breach of the provisions of criminal procedure under LAW in conjunction with LAW of ] C[riminal ] P[rocedure ] are well - founded . The reasoning of the impugned decision states that the meeting , held after the indictment had been lodged , at which the panel deliberated on [ the defendant 's ] detention , was held in the absence of ORG , the defence lawyer officially appointed for the defendant PERSON , in accordance with LAW ORG . However , the defendant questioned the finding of the first - instance court that defence counsel had been properly summoned to the panel meeting in question , pursuant to LAW ORG . The defendant alleged in his appeal that his officially appointed defence counsel had not been served with the decision of his appointment prior to the panel meeting of CARDINAL DATE where [ the panel ] had been deliberating on his detention . Defence counsel had not been summoned to the panel meeting in question . The defendant maintained that the summons for the panel meeting had been sent to his defence counsel by fax on DATE at TIME He enclosed a copy of the minutes of a different hearing held before FAC on DATE in proceedings no . P-CARDINAL/CARDINAL showing that [ the lawyer appointed for him ] had been present at that hearing TIME and that , therefore , since the panel meeting was held at TIME , his defence counsel had not been properly summoned to that meeting .

The above circumstances show that the defence lawyer was not properly summoned to the panel meeting at which the defendant 's detention was deliberated upon , despite the fact that , pursuant to LAW ORG , he should have received the summons in time in order to be able to appear . Therefore , the right of the defendant to be defended by officially appointed counsel , who could only be a practising lawyer , at a panel meeting at which the decision on his detention was to be taken , and [ whose absence ] might influence that decision , was infringed .

It is also important to point out that the facts concerning the question whether the appointed lawyer received the decision of his appointment and whether he was properly summoned to the panel meeting at which the question of the defendant 's detention was to be deliberated upon could not be taken to have been correctly and sufficiently established , in view of the reasons stated above .

The first - instance court must establish whether the lawyer PERSON from GPE received , and if so , when , the decision on his appointment as defence counsel and it must then properly summon him to a fresh panel meeting where the possibility of [ implementing ] a custodial measure is to be deliberated .

In view of the above considerations , the appeal of the defendant PERSON is to be allowed , the impugned decision quashed ( but not the detention ) and the case remitted to the first - instance court for fresh deliberation ( LAW of the ORG ) . ”
